column5: Anyone know where i can get someone to look at my motor in the midland area?  i know of jacknjills but have heard of them charging high service charges for minor work, im looking for an honest service tech.  basically, i may have a leak in my lower unit, every time i change the lower unit oil, its milky that means water is mixing with oil.  im always changing the washer when i change the oil.  friend suggested i get a pressure check to see if there are any leakes.  so can anyone help me out?
We've got an OFC'r at the shop at Beacon Bay... hope he pokes his head in. Anyone with the tools can do the work...
